entry.title: Welcome!
entry.content:
Hello World! We are very excited to welcome you to our community blog and blockchain information resource produced by Blockchain Tech Corp.

We believe the blockchain will change the world and our goal for this website is to create a high quality educational / information resource to help everyone understand why, and learn how they can get involved today.

Connect with us on Twitter & Facebook! We would love to hear your comments, suggestions, or content requests. Not on social media? We love reading your emails, too.

What’s Inside:

A blog: We will be posting periodically about developments in blockchain technology, Bitcoin, cryptography, and open source software, as well as the latest news from Blockchain Tech Corp.

Information: Informational resources to learn more about the amazing technologies, concepts, and potential in this exciting new space.

Guides: Step-by-step guides designed to help you get up and running with Bitcoin and blockchain technology as quickly as possible.

Check back regularly or subscribe to our RSS feed to make sure you don’t miss anything!

entry.title: Blockchain Tech Corp. Conducts 7th GOP Debate Straw Poll Using Blockchain Voting System
entry.content:
PRESS RELEASE: 1/28/2016

Ted Cruz Voted Winner of 7th GOP Presidential Debate

NEW YORK — Blockchain Tech Corp. conducted a straw poll of Thursday night’s Fox News GOP Presidential Debate held at New York’s Metropolitan Republican Club in a post-debate watch party. Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio were the clear crowd favorites in the absence of previously high scoring candidate Donald Trump.

The voting technology employed to conduct the straw poll utilizes the security features of the “blockchain” — the groundbreaking new technology underlying the digital currency Bitcoin. This innovation enables the company to conduct secure, tamper resistant elections by using the blockchain as a high-tech audit trail to ensure voting records are transparently verifiable and all votes are unique.

The poll was a follow up to earlier polls held at the club also conducted by Blockchain Apparatus at each of the previous GOP debates. Executives with Blockchain Technologies Corporation say the company is currently servicing labor Union elections and will continue to showcase its ground breaking voting technology throughout the 2016 election cycle.

Participants in the poll were asked: “who do you think won tonight’s debate?” Out of 50 participants, Cruz received the most votes with 20, Rubio came in second with 13 votes.

Below are the official results from Fox Business GOP Presidential Debate straw poll conducted at the New York Metropolitan Republican Club:

Ted Cruz 20
Marco Rubio 13
Jeb Bush 7
Chris Christie 6
Rand Paul 3
John Kasich 1
Ben Carson 0

Blockchain Technologies Corp. is a part of Global Arena Holding Inc (GAHC: OTC US). They are working to bring modern technology and transparency to the election process. The company has filed a non-provisional utility patent titled ‘System and Method For Securely Receiving And Counting Votes In An Election’ – Application #14820530.

For more information visit www.blockchaintechcorp.com, follow us on Twitter @blocktechcorp, or email info@blocktechcorp.com.

entry.title: Blockchain Tech Corp. Conducts Straw Poll Following 5th GOP Debate Using Blockchain Voting System
entry.content:
PRESS RELEASE: 12/15/2015

Ted Cruz Voted Winner by New York Metropolitan Republican Club

Blockchain Tech Corp. conducted a straw poll following the CNN / Salem Radio GOP Debate held at the Venetian in Las Vegas on December 15th, 2015. The poll was conducted at a watch party held at New York’s Metropolitan Republican Club. Ted Cruz had the most support following the debate, followed by Donald Trump.

The voting technology employed utilizes the blockchain — the technology underlying the security of the digital currency Bitcoin. This allows the company to conduct secure, tamper resistant elections by using the blockchain as a high-tech audit trail to ensure voting records are transparently verifiable and all votes are unique.

Speaking on an earlier straw poll conducted by Blockchain Tech Corp., the manager of the Metropolitan Club, Jeff Goolsby, said:

“I think what they bring to the voting process is the future of free and open elections.”

Executives with Blockchain Technologies Corporation say the company will continue to showcase its voting technology throughout the 2016 election cycle.

Participants in the poll were asked: “who do you think won tonight’s debate?” Out of 86 potential voters, the clear winner was Ted Cruz with 33 votes; Donald Trump, the favorite from the previous GOP debate, only received 19 votes this time.

Below are the official results from Blockchain Tech Corp.’s 5th GOP Presidential Debate Straw Poll:

  • Ted Cruz - 33
  • Donald Trump - 19
  • Marco Rubio - 13
  • Chris Christie - 8
  • Rand Paul - 7
  • Carly Fiorina - 4
  • Jeb Bush - 1
  • John Kasich - 1
  • Ben Carson - 0

Blockchain Technologies Corporation is a part of Global Arena Holding Inc (GAHC: OTC US). They are working to bring modern technology and transparency to the election process. The company has filed a non-provisional utility patent titled ‘System and Method For Securely Receiving And Counting Votes In An Election’ – Application #14820530.

entry.title: Meet Blockchain Technologies Corp.
entry.content:
Find Us: Web | Twitter | Facebook | CrunchBase | AngelList

We Put The Blockchain To Work.

Blockchain Tech Corp. is an innovative software development company creating unique solutions to real-world problems by leveraging the power of blockchain technology.

Our blockchain voting system uses verifiable blockchain audit trails to restore trust in democratic elections by minimizing the potential for foul play.

We also operate cutting edge Bitcoin ATMs in New York City that allow anyone to buy into Bitcoin with cash on demand, lowering the barrier to entry for those that want to get started using Bitcoin.

We Are 100% Dedicated To Bitcoin & The Blockchain.

Our founder, Nick Spanos, has been involved with Bitcoin since the early days.

In late 2013, Nick opened Bitcoin Center NYC, a large 5,000 sq. ft. retail space right on Wall Street - directly across from the New York Stock Exchange.
